This is a Rich text field in a single row.  The headline grid component is placed above. 

Centred text Bold

Rich Text Right column.

The heart of a garage door opener system is the motor, which generates the power necessary to lift and lower the door. Motors come in different types and power ratings, with the most common

being the AC (alternating current) and DC (direct current) motors. AC motors are generally more affordable and were the standard for many years, while DC motors are quieter, more energy-efficient, and often offer smoother operation.

The power rating, expressed in horsepower (HP) or Newton-meters (Nm), determines the motor's capacity to handle different door sizes and weights. It is essential to select a motor with the appropriate power rating to ensure the system's longevity and reliable operation.
